newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea's 1996 rice output rise 13 pct yr on yr.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea's 1996 rice output rise 13 pct yr on yr.

text.p: South Korea's Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry said on Wednesday the country's rice production rose 13 percent to 5,323,000 tonnes this year from 4,695,000 tonnes in 1995.
The agriculture ministry said in a statement that the output figure was well above its recent forecast of 5,071,680 tonnes for this year.
The crop was the second largest in the past five years, following the 5,331,312 tonnes harvested in 1992.
Favourable weather this year has boosted the country's rice crop and a sharp slowdown in the decline in area under rice paddy has also helped, the statement said.
The loss of land used for rice cultivation this year was projected at 6,000 hectares, leaving the total rice area at 1.05 million hectares. Last year 47,000 hectares were lost.
The ministry said the yield from 10 acres (4 hectares) of rice paddy rose about 14 percent to 507 kgs in 1996 from 445 kgs in 1995.
